instruction:
Answer according to the following questions, with clarity and no excessive nonsense
Causes of body shake during idling
answer:
Body shake during idling can be caused by the following reasons:

1. Engine problems: The unstable operation of the engine may be due to the failure of the spark plug, fuel injector or fuel supply system, resulting in insufficient combustion, which in turn causes the body to shake.

2. Ignition system failure: Ignition system components such as ignition coils, high-voltage wires, or distributors are damaged or aging, which may cause engine ignition instability and cause idle jitter.

3. Intake system failure: Air filter blockage, intake manifold leakage or throttle dirt accumulation may lead to poor intake, affect the normal operation of the engine, and cause idle jitter.

4. Carbon deposition problem: Carbon deposition inside the engine may cause valves, valve seats, piston rings and other components to become stuck, affecting the normal operation of the engine and causing idle jitter.

5. Suspension system problems: Damage or aging of shock absorbers, ball heads, suspension arms and other components of the suspension system may cause the body to shake when idling.

6. Tire problems: Problems such as unbalanced tires, insufficient tire pressure, or uneven tire wear can cause the body to shake when idling.

7. Brake system failure: Brake lag or brake disc deformation can cause the vehicle to shake when idling.

In order to solve the problem of body shake during idling, it is recommended to inspect and repair the above possible causes.
reference:
Idle body shake is a condition that many car owners often encounter. If the owner starts the vehicle or stops the vehicle without turning off the engine, if the body shake is found to be obvious, it may mean that the vehicle has the following four conditions:

1. Spark plug or high voltage coil problem
This problem is a more common problem, especially the problem of spark plugs, normal use of vehicles generally after 50,000 km may gradually appear this problem. Many repair shops four S 20,000 km requires the replacement of spark plugs, personal advice do not worry, idle jitter when considering the replacement of spark plugs.

The possibility of high-voltage coil damage is actually very low. The current high-voltage coil may not need to be replaced for a lifetime, and it can be simply cleaned. When the idle jitter fails to solve the problem after replacing the spark plug, the working condition of the high-voltage conductor and ignition coil, the poor working of the ignition system, and the poor jumping condition of the spark plug can also lead to such failures.
Solution: Check the spark plug for excessive carbon deposits and replace the spark plug.

2. Engine carbon deposition is serious
The most common cause of car jitter is the dirty throttle or excessive carbon deposits in the fuel injector. When there is too much carbon deposits inside the engine, the gasoline ejected by the cold start injector will be absorbed by the carbon deposits, resulting in the cold start mixture being too thin, making it difficult to start. In this case, it is easy to get off the car only when the gasoline absorbed by the carbon deposits is saturated. The gasoline adsorbed on the carbon deposits after landing will be sucked into the cylinder by the vacuum suction of the engine and burned, which will make the mixture thicker. The combustible mixture of the engine is thin and thick, causing idle jitter after cold start. The lower the temperature, the greater the amount of oil required for a cold start, and the more the presence of carbon deposits will affect the smoothness of the cold start.

But similar to this problem, as long as the vehicle is in normal use, the current vehicle 150,000 even within 200,000 kilometers does not need to consider this problem. Even if some carbon deposits are formed, they will not affect the changes in driving and fuel consumption. Many repair shops mislead consumers by taking advantage of this problem. Consumers spend a lot of unnecessary expenses.

Another point to explain is that now to refuel or to maintain the car, the staff will enthusiastically promote gasoline or oil additives, it is recommended that new cars or normal forms of vehicles within 200,000 kilometers do not add indiscriminately. Briefly explain the so-called no-dismantling removal of carbon deposits must require a lot of acid corrosion. It is unknown whether carbon deposits can be removed, but the damage of acid products to the engine cylinder pad is very serious, and some oil additives will leave a large number of sticky paste-like objects in the oil pan that cannot be removed without dismantling, resulting in less oil retention, increasing the loss of oil and exacerbating the wear and tear of the engine.
Solution: Clean the oil circuit and check whether the idle motor has carbon deposits.

3. Oil pressure is unstable
If you have cleaned the engine carbon deposits, washed the throttle, replaced the oil pad and spark plugs, etc., and still find that the body is shaking during idling, it is recommended that you go to the 4S shop to check whether the fuel supply pressure and the intake pressure sensor are normal. If the oil pump supply pressure is abnormal or the intake pressure sensor value is wrong and the work is poor, it will cause the body to shake.

Now the vehicle can also find this problem through the driving computer data, so be sure to check the driving computer data before going to the physical inspection for similar problems.
Solution: Check the oil pressure and replace parts if necessary.

4. Aging of engine components
Car jitter is also related to the aging of the engine foot (also known as the paw pad). The engine foot is actually the shock absorption system of the engine. The engine foot is responsible for absorbing the subtle jitter of the engine when it is running. If there is a problem with the engine foot, these vibrations will be transmitted to the steering wheel and the cab, causing jitter during idling.

The damage of this part and the shaking are obvious. Sitting in the cab, the steering wheel and the car body will be accompanied by shaking and shaking. Generally, it is relatively serious and easy to find. It is recommended that if there is shaking, especially when idling, go to the four S for inspection and testing to find the corresponding cause and solve the safest and safest one.
Solution: Replace the parts.

instruction:
Answer according to the following questions, with clarity and no excessive nonsense
Is it illegal to overtake on a highway?
answer: Overtaking on a highway is an offence.
reference: Overtaking and speeding is illegal. Instantaneous speeding is not allowed when overtaking, and instantaneous speeding is illegal; driving medium-sized and above passenger-carrying trucks, school buses, and dangerous goods transportation vehicles on highways and roads other than urban expressways or driving other motor vehicles to exceed the specified speed shall be subject to fines in addition to points. Traffic regulations stipulate that instantaneous speeding is not allowed when overtaking, and instantaneous speeding is illegal. Speeding is a dangerous behavior. It is a very serious traffic violation, and the harm is relatively large. Driving a medium-sized or above passenger-carrying truck, school bus, or dangerous goods transport vehicle on a highway or urban expressway exceeding the specified speed by more than 20% per hour or on a road other than an expressway or an urban expressway exceeding the specified speed by more than 50% per hour, and driving other motor vehicles exceeding the specified speed by more than 50%, 12 points will be charged at a time, and a fine will also be paid. Driving a medium-sized or above passenger-carrying truck, school bus, or dangerous goods transport vehicle on a road other than an expressway or an urban expressway or driving other motor vehicle exceeding the specified speed by more than 20% per hour and not reaching 50%, 6 points will be charged at a time, and a fine will also be paid. Driving a medium-sized or above passenger-carrying truck or a dangerous goods transportation vehicle on a highway or a road other than an urban expressway, or driving another motor vehicle at a speed exceeding the prescribed speed by less than 20%, shall be subject to a fine.

instruction:
Answer according to the following questions, with clarity and no excessive nonsense
Burned tires start without hurting the car
answer: Burned tires can cause certain damage to the vehicle.
reference: The so-called tire burn start is still quite harmful to the car, mainly causing greater wear and tear on the tires and clutch plates, shortening the service life of the tires and clutch. The so-called tire burn start is often caused by the occasional situation of dazzling skills and poor technology, and it is a wrong way to start. A tire burn refers to the phenomenon that the rear wheel idles when the rear wheel is idled by stepping on the brake and accelerator at the same time with the rear drive (with certain skills, the front wheel can not move and the rear wheel idles). The specific manifestation is that the tire generates smoke due to excessive friction. This starting method is very harmful to the tire and clutch, so try not to use this method to start, so as not to shorten the service life of the car.

instruction:
Answer according to the following questions, with clarity and no excessive nonsense
Is there a high probability of spontaneous combustion of new energy vehicles?
answer: Yes. According to statistics, the probability of spontaneous combustion of new energy vehicles is more than 1 in 1 million.
reference:
2.939 million, this figure is not the cumulative sales of a certain brand, but the sales of new energy vehicles in our country from January to May this year. The Passenger Federation predicts that the sales of new energy vehicles will reach a record high this year, and the annual sales will exceed 8.50 million, and the penetration rate is expected to reach 36%. The current operating status is basically in line with the forecast.

While seeing the good news, we must also face some issues rationally. For example, another set of figures should also be taken seriously. According to the statistics of the Ministry of Emergency Management of the People's Republic of China, there were a total of 640 new energy vehicle fires in Quarter 1 in 2022, which is equivalent to an average of more than 7 new energy vehicle fire accidents per day. The probability is much higher than that of traditional fuel vehicles. It is no exaggeration to say that spontaneous combustion has become one of the main safety hazards of new energy vehicles. Prepare for a rainy day and prevent problems before they occur. We should do the following at ordinary times.
Some new energy car owners may panic when they see this. In fact, don't worry too much. Spontaneous fire is an exception after all. Now the mainstream tram brands on the market are very good at battery protection, and the failure rate is extremely low. We just need to pay more attention when using the car. Please refer to the following points in battery protection;
1. Avoid charging the battery to 100% or discharging it to 0% as often as possible, and try to keep the battery charged and discharged within the range of 20-80% to prolong the service life of the battery.
2 Charge regularly, rather than waiting for the battery to fully run out of booster charge. Choose the right time to charge the battery to around 80%, which can provide enough range when needed and reduce overcharging of the battery.
3 Before using the charging pile, carefully check whether the socket and cable are intact to ensure that there is no damage or debris. This can avoid short circuits or leakage during use of the charging pile, thereby reducing the risk of spontaneous combustion of the vehicle.

New energy owners should also try to avoid wading or driving in bad road conditions, because the battery pack is located at the bottom of the vehicle chassis. If the vehicle wades or drives on bad roads, it is easy to cause damage to the battery pack, thereby increasing the risk of spontaneous combustion. Because the battery pack is installed at the bottom of the vehicle chassis, if the vehicle wades or drags the bottom, it is easy to cause damage to the battery pack and increase the risk of spontaneous combustion. In addition, regular vehicle maintenance and inspection should be done.

instruction:
Answer according to the following questions, with clarity and no excessive nonsense
How to solve the problem of starting a cold car?
answer:
Cold car start difficulties can be caused by a variety of reasons. Here are some common solutions:
1. Check the battery: If the battery is low or aging, it will cause difficulty in starting. It can be solved by replacing the battery with a new one.
2. Check the spark plug: dirty or seriously worn spark plugs can also affect the start. Spark plugs need to be cleaned or replaced.
3. Check the fuel system: blocked fuel filter, oil pump failure, etc. may cause difficulty in starting. Relevant maintenance and replacement are recommended.
4. Check the air filter: A dirty air filter will affect the engine intake and thus start. It should be cleaned or replaced in time.
5. Check the throttle: Excessive carbon deposition in the throttle will affect the normal operation of the engine, which can be solved by cleaning the throttle.
6. Check the water temperature sensor: Damage to the water temperature sensor will cause the ECU to fail to correctly judge the engine temperature, which will affect the start. A new water temperature sensor needs to be replaced.
The above is only the general handling method. If the problem persists, it is recommended to go to a professional auto repair shop for comprehensive inspection and repair.
reference:
Replace high-quality oil: In cold weather, the fluidity of the oil becomes worse and the viscosity increases, which will increase the resistance of the engine to start. Therefore, changing high-quality oil can improve this situation.
Use a heater: If your vehicle is equipped with a heater, using it in cold weather can help you start your vehicle easily.
Replace the battery: Battery loss is one of the common reasons why the car will not start. If your battery has been used for a long time, it is recommended to replace it with a new one.
Use antifreeze: In cold weather, water freezes inside the engine, which can make the engine not work properly. Therefore, make sure that the freezing point of antifreeze is lower than the local minimum temperature.
Warm up the engine: Before starting the vehicle, open the door and start the warm air system to raise the indoor temperature. Then open the hood, place a heater or electric blanket over the engine, and allow some time for the engine to reach the right temperature. This can greatly reduce the problem of difficult start.
Check the ignition system: The ignition system is one of the keys to the normal operation of the car. If there is a problem with the ignition system, the car will not start normally. Therefore, regularly check the ignition coil and spark plug for aging and other problems, and replace them in time.
Regular maintenance: Regular maintenance can help you detect and solve problems in your car in a timely manner. For example, replacing the air filter, oil filter and other accessories can ensure the normal operation of the engine and reduce the problem of difficult start.
In addition, it is also important to check the oil circuit and engine for any problems. If the problem cannot be solved, it is recommended to send the vehicle to a 4S shop for professional inspection and repair.
